body.p:
Louisville Ky. Decr 4th 1863.
His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlett
Dear Sir.

Some months since a man by the name Marion Rowland who has for sometime been under a bad reputation was brought before me charged with having stolen a lot of coffee from a Grocer in this city which was found at the House of Michael Fahay

On the Examination of the case Fahay was Introduced as a witness & proved that he was working on the farm of a Brother in Law of Rowland, that Rowland came to his house at night & brought the coffee giving some account of haveing purchased it & asked him to keep it for him till the next day & he not suspecting that it was stolen, consented & took charge of the coffee. The party who lost it gave Information of his loss to the police & they found it at the house of Fahay, on this & other Testimony as to Rowlands character. He (Rowland) was held to answer in the circuit court. When the case was taken up by the Grand Jury they returned a a Indictment against Fahay & discharged Rowland Fahay was arrested & committed to Jail an Mr. R. A. Hamilton who was familiar with the proof in the case & being satisfied that Fahay was Innocent became his security for his appearance in the circuit court in the sum of $300. Fahay who is a verry Ignorant man became alarmed & failed to appear & a forfeiture of the recognizance was Entered

and Judgement will be entered at the next Term, unless your Excellency will remit the penalty. Mr Hamilton was Induced solely by his kind feelings to become the security of Fahay & not for any pecuniary consideration I would be glad to see him released from the liability. I feel well assured that Fahay was Innocent of any Intentional wrong and was Induced to runaway because of the alarm & fear of a Trial opperating on a weak mind

I am Dr Sir verry
respectfully Yr obt servt
Geo. W. Johnston
Mr Hamilton is not able to pay more than the commissions of comths atty. and other costs. I hope your Excellency will relieve ^him^ from the residue

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
R A. Hamilton
$300.
26th Apl/ 64
Remit all except 30 percent the fees of Comths atty & the costs of prosecution
Thos E Bramlette
